name: Mujeres por Africa
description: It is a Spanish NGO that works in Africa and Spain, to promote women in Africa through education, exchange fellowship programs for professionals, entrepeunership projects, etc.

name: Asociación de Mujeres Investigadoras y Tecnológas (AMIT)
description: Spanish NGO composed by scientist and technologist from different fields that work in Science, Technology or management of science and technology in organizations or public and private Spanish research centers.

name: CNIO Women in Science (WISE)
description: Women in Science Office at the Spanish National Cancer Research Center (CNIO), that organize events, seminars to rainse awareness in gender issues, and look for inequeties in the scientific career, trying to focus on them and changed them through policy or conduct rules.

name: Girls Who Code
description: Girls Who Code free after school Clubs launch for 2017-2018, introducing coding to 30K girls

name: Chick Tech
description: ChickTech is a nonprofit dedicated to retaining women in the technology workforce and increasing the number of women and girls pursuing technology-based careers.

name: Let Toys Be Toys
description: Let Toys Be Toys campaign is asking the toy and publishing industries to stop limiting children’s interests by promoting some toys and books as only suitable for girls, and others only for boys.

name: Greenlight 4 Girls
description: Greenlight for girls is an international organisation dedicated to inspire girls of all ages and backgrounds to pursue STEM subjects - Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics - by introducing them to the world of science in fun and exciting ways!

name: STEMettes
description: We’re showing the next generation that girls do Science, Technology, Engineering & Maths (STEM) too at our free, fun, food-filled experiences.

name: Tech Mums
description: We help mums to harness the power of technology. Learn about social media, online safety, coding and more in our free workshops.

name: Women of the World Festival
description: WOW – Women of the World festival celebrates women and girls, and looks at the obstacles that stop them from achieving their potential.

name: Anita Borg Institute
description: At AnitaB.org, we envision a future where the people who imagine and build technology mirror the people and societies for whom they build it. We connect, inspire, and guide women in computing, and organizations that view technology innovation as a strategic imperative.

name: Geek Girl MeetUp
description: A group of passionate women working in tech, design and startups.

name: Ladies Of Code
description: We are an international community of professional women developers.

name: Django Girls
description: Django Girls is a non-profit organization and a community that empowers and helps women to organize free, one-day programming workshops by providing tools, resources and support. We are a volunteer run organization with hundreds of people contributing to bring more amazing women into the world of technology.

name: Code First Girls
description: Code First: Girls works with companies and with men and women directly, to help increase the number of women in tech

name: Ada's List
description: Ada's list is a global community for women in tech, based on principles of inclusion, empowerment and diversity

name: EnRedadas, for the Arts and Technology
description: EnRedadas works promoting safe spaces for women all ages at the intersection between feminism, arts and technology

name: Karkhana
description: Designing learning experiences for kids. Hands on STEAM activities

name: The Ada Initiative
description: The Ada Initiative helps women get and stay involved in open source, open data, open education, and other areas of free and open technology and culture.

name: COACh
description: Has helped the career advancement of over 20,000 women scientists and engineers in the US, Asia, Africa and Latin America.
locations: US, Asia, Africa and Latin America

name: Anita Borg Institute
description: The Anita Borg Institute for Women and Technology is a nonprofit organization founded by computer scientist Anita Borg. The institute’s primary aim is to recruit, retain, and advance women in technology.

name: Passion Projects
description: Talks from incredible women in tech every month.

name: Society of Women Engineers
description: For more than six decades, SWE has given women engineers a unique place and voice within the engineering industry. Our organization is centered around a passion for our members' success and continues to evolve with the challenges and opportunities reflected in today's exciting engineering and technology specialties.

name: Pink Programming
description: Pink Programming is a non-profit organization. We exist to enable more women to discover the joy of programming. Our goal is to increase the proportion of women working in the tech industry. We believe this is good for equality and equal opportunity for all.
